title: Destination definition schema
description: The schema for a destination definition. This is used to validate the destination definition configuration files (db-config.json).

name.title: Name
name.description: A unique name for a destination without any whitespace or special characters.
name.$comment: Typically, all the characters are in uppercase with words separated by underscores.

displayName.title: Display Name
displayName.description: A human-readable name for a destination, typically, derived from the branding of the destination.
displayName.$comment: This will be used in the front-end (web app), docs, etc. to identify a destination. As this will also be used in the 'integrations' object interpreted by SDKs and the server, it should also be a unique identifier for a destination.

category.title: Category
category.$comment: Typically, needs to be defined only for warehouse destinations.

config.title: Configuration
config.description: This hosts all the destination parameters.

rudderAccountId.title: Rudder Account Id
rudderAccountId.description: The account definitionId for the destination.

rudderDeleteAccountId.title: Rudder Delete Account Id
rudderDeleteAccountId.description: The delete account definitionId for the destination used for user deletion.

transformAtV1.title: Transform At V1
transformAtV1.description: The module in the server that should initiate destination transformation.

features.title: list of destination features
features.description: The list of features supported by the destination.

saveDestinationResponse.title: Save Destination Response
saveDestinationResponse.description: Whether the destination response should be saved for successful jobs in the jobs database.
saveDestinationResponse.$comment: By default, the response data is saved for the failed jobs. This flag can be used to control the behavior for successful jobs.

throttlingCost.title: Throttling Cost
throttlingCost.description: Defines the throttling parameters for the destination that can have intermediate API calls during transformation.
throttlingCost.$comment: The server uses this information while picking the events from the jobs database during router transformation. This must be defined only for destinations with different rate limits per event type, as the endpoints usually differ.

eventType.title: Event Type
eventType.description: The throttling parameters for each event type.

^(track|identify|page|screen|alias|group.title: The maximum number of external API calls that can happen during the destination transformation for the event type.

supportedSourceTypes.title: Supported Source Types
supportedSourceTypes.description: The source types supported by the destination for connection.
supportedSourceTypes.$comment: This is used to display the supported source types in the UI and mandatorily specified.

supportedMessageTypes.title: Supported Message Types
supportedMessageTypes.description: The message types supported by the destination.
supportedMessageTypes.$comment: Define this field only to filter out unsupported event types early in the data pipeline. The server (processor) will drop these events and log them in the proc_error tables instead of destination transformation. If the value is an empty array, all the event types are dropped.

oneOf.description: An array of event types supported in the cloud mode.
oneOf.$comment: This needs to be mandatorily defined if a destination supports cloud mode.

oneOf.description: An object with connection modes as keys. This is the new format for defining the supported message types and will also allow client SDKs to filter out unsupported event types early. However, this is not yet supported by the SDKs.
An object with source types as keys.

supportedConnectionModes.title: Supported Connection Modes
supportedConnectionModes.description: The map of connection modes supported by the destination per source type.

^(android|androidKotlin|ios|iosSwift|web.title: Connection Modes
^(android|androidKotlin|ios|iosSwift|web.description: The connection modes supported by the destination for the source type.
^(android|androidKotlin|ios|iosSwift|web.$comment: This is used to display the supported connection modes in the UI.

hybridModeCloudEventsFilter.title: Hybrid Mode Cloud Events Filter
hybridModeCloudEventsFilter.description: This is a map of event types supported by destination per source type in the hybrid connection mode.
hybridModeCloudEventsFilter.$comment: This is used to filter out cloud events in hybrid mode. This is used only for destinations that support hybrid mode.

^(android|androidKotlin|ios|iosSwift|web.title: Source Type Filter Map
^(android|androidKotlin|ios|iosSwift|web.description: The event types supported by the destination for the source type.

messageType.title: Message Types
messageType.description: The event types supported by the destination for the source type.

cdkV2Enabled.title: CDK V2 Enabled
cdkV2Enabled.description: Whether to use CDK V2 implementation for destination transformation.

cdkEnabled.title: CDK V1 Enabled
cdkEnabled.description: Whether to use CDK V1 implementation for destination transformation.

destConfig.title: Destination Configuration
destConfig.description: The parameters for the destination that the user can configure.
destConfig.$comment: This is used to display default and source type specific destination configuration in the UI.

includeKeys.title: Include Keys
includeKeys.description: The list of properties that are to be included in the destination configuration sent to the client SDKs via source configuration response.
includeKeys.$comment: For destinations that support device/hybrid mode, this should be mandatorily defined. Otherwise, it should not be defined at all. No fields will be included in the destination configuration if this field is not defined or empty.

excludeKeys.title: Exclude Keys
excludeKeys.description: The list of properties to be excluded in the destination configuration sent to the client SDKs via source configuration response.
excludeKeys.$comment: This field needs to be defined only if the destination supports device/hybrid mode. Otherwise, it should not be defined at all. The filter is applied after the 'includeKeys' filtering logic. So, if a property is included in both lists, it'll be eventually dropped.

secretKeys.title: Secret Keys
secretKeys.description: The keys that are to be treated as secrets in the destination configuration.
secretKeys.$comment: In the UI, these fields will be masked and only allowed to be edited (not viewed) on the destination configuration page. Moreover, the values for these fields are stored in a separate database.

immutableKeys.title: Immutable Keys
immutableKeys.description: The keys that are to be treated as Immutable in the destination configuration.
immutableKeys.$comment: In the UI, these fields can only be set in the creation flow and cannot be edited again.

auth.title: Authentication
auth.description: The authentication parameters for the destination.

type.title: Type
type.description: The mechanism of authentication active for the destination.

role.title: Role
role.description: This is a unique identifier for the authentication.
role.$comment: Typically, it is the destination 'name' field but can changed to something else.

rudderScopes.title: Rudder Scopes
rudderScopes.description: The operations for which authentication should be used.
rudderScopes.$comment: 'delivery' - event delivery requests. 'delete' - user deletion requests

options.title: Options
options.$comment: This hosts miscellaneous information about the destination.

isBeta.title: Is Beta
isBeta.description: Whether the destination is in beta.
isBeta.$comment: This is used to display a 'beta' badge in the UI.

disableLiveEvents.title: Disable Live Events
disableLiveEvents.description: Whether the destination live events viewer should be disabled.
disableLiveEvents.$comment: This is used to disable live events viewer for the destination.

anyOf.title: Hidden
anyOf.$comment: This is used to hide the destination from the UI.

anyOf.title: Hidden
anyOf.$comment: This is used to hide the destination from the UI.

featureFlagName.title: Feature Flag Name
featureFlagName.description: The feature flag name to hide the destination.
featureFlagName.$comment: This is used to hide the destination from the UI based on the feature flag.

featureFlagValue.title: Feature Flag Value
featureFlagValue.description: The feature flag value to hide the destination.
featureFlagValue.$comment: This is used to hide the destination from the UI based on the feature flag value.

deprecated.title: Deprecated
deprecated.$comment: This is used to display a 'deprecated' badge in the UI.

deprecationLabel.title: Deprecation Label
deprecationLabel.description: The deprecation label for the destination.
deprecationLabel.$comment: This is used to display a deprecation label in the UI when options.deprecated is 'true'.

allowCreationWhenDeprecated.title: Allow Destination Creation When Deprecated
allowCreationWhenDeprecated.description: Whether new instances of the 'deprecated' destination are still allowed to be created in the UI.
allowCreationWhenDeprecated.$comment: This is applicable only if 'options.deprecated' is 'true'. By default, users are not allowed to create new instances of 'deprecated' destinations.

destinationFeatures.title: Destination Features
destinationFeatures.description: The features supported by the destination.

vdmLabels.title: VDM Labels
vdmLabels.description: The VDM labels supported by the destination.

newAudienceAlternateLabel.title: New Audience Alternate Label
newAudienceAlternateLabel.description: The alternate label for the 'New Audience' VDM label.
newAudienceAlternateLabel.$comment: This is used to display the alternate label in the UI when the destination supports the 'New Audience' VDM label.

existingAudienceAlternateLabel.title: Existing Audience Alternate Label
existingAudienceAlternateLabel.description: The alternate label for the 'Existing Audience' VDM label.
existingAudienceAlternateLabel.$comment: This is used to display the alternate label in the UI when the destination supports the 'Existing Audience' VDM label.

audienceAlternateLabel.title: Audience Alternate Label
audienceAlternateLabel.description: The alternate label for the 'Audience' VDM label.
audienceAlternateLabel.$comment: This is used to display the alternate label in the UI when the destination supports the 'Audience' VDM label.

supportsCustomMappings.title: Supports Custom Mappings
supportsCustomMappings.description: Whether the destination supports custom mappings.
supportsCustomMappings.$comment: This is used to display the 'Custom Mappings' tab in the UI.
